edu.syr.sndd.readData

Class AgeUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.syr.sndd.readData.AgeUtils

  • public class AgeUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a utility class to read the age model data, converts a depth to its age. It does not implement any constructor but read the age model data in the static block.
    Author:
    Stoney Q. Gan

      • read2StrList

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> read2StrList(java.lang.String fileName,
                                            boolean hd)
                                                     throws java.io.IOException
        read data from the input file and return as a list of String. Includes the headings as the first element if hd is true, otherwise, read and discard the first line.
        Parameters:
        fileName - input file assumed to be a text file.
        hd - indicate whether to return the haeding line.
        Returns:
        a list of strings each of which is a depth-age pair.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • linearInterpolate

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> linearInterpolate(double[] idepth,
                                                 double[] iage,
                                                 double ageInterval)
        This method gets a list of evenly age spaced age-depth pairs by resampling with a fixed age interval. Resampling uses the simple linear interpolation.
        Parameters:
        idepth - input of depth array;
        iage - input of age array;
        interval - age interval;
        Returns:
        A list of age/depth pair

      • calFirstAge

        public static double calFirstAge(double initAge,
                 double ageInterval)
        Find an first age for a time series by the given original initial age and age interval. This is to prepare the first data in an evenly spaced time series.
        Parameters:
        initAge - the first age value.
        ageInterval - the age interval for the time series.
        Returns:

                            double[] aWin)
        Implemented the input side convolution algorithm by Steven Smith, 1998
        Parameters:
        inputSignals - an array of doubles that to be convoluted.
        aWin - the window (system) the input signals will go through.
        Returns:
        the output signals by convoluted the input signal with the window.
